reviews.text: Rented unit C203 for a weeklong stay with six guests, including 3 children ranging in ages 1-7. We chose the condo for the elaborate pool: two waterslides and a meandering canal with waterfalls. We also found a good value of ~$280 per night incl taxes on VRBO.com. Go through a private owner and save $$ over booking w/ Outrigger. What a value: 2 bdrm, 3 ba, and a sleeper sofa. Wolf range and Subzero fridge and dual dishwashers. Fully equipped kitchen. Only missing appliances happened to be the two we use the most: toaster oven and rice cooker. Loved everything in the condo with the exception of a very squeaky bed. For those with small children that nap during the day, you may request a unit that has carpet in the hallway in front of the unit. Some of the hallways are heavy stone tiles and the housekeeping carts make a lot of noise over them - it may wake up sleeping beauty. The location in Kapaa is perfect for groceries with Foodland and Safeway right across the street (couldn't believe other residents actually drove across the street to shop.) Starbucks, Cold Stone, McD's, and other restaurants across the street too. Within 2 miles to Wailua River kayaks, Lydgate State Park, and historic Kapaa town. Don't miss the beautiful jogging trail starting in town going north along the coastline. You can keep Poipu - we're staying in Kapaa every time.

reviews.title: Newest condo/resort in Kauai

reviews.text: The property is one of the newer ones on the island, and it shows. Everything was spotless, and the location is very quiet. The furnishings were very well-kept and comfortable, and the kitchen was very large and had great, high-end appliances, and everything one could possibly hope for, for cooking meals. There's a little welcome basket with coffee, etc. Note that some of the units are prviately owned and so the decor may be very slightly different among different units at the same resort, although very consistent. We only discovered this because we stayed at two different units (both 1-bedroom units) because we broke up our trip in Kauai with a stay in Princeville in the middle (we stayed at the Westin, which I've also reviewed). The one bedroom units we stayed in had a living area (note that because the kitchen is large, the living area/dining area is somewhat small. It was more than sufficient for me and my husband, but would be a little tight for more than a couple. There was a small balcony off the bedroom with a small table and two chairs, where we ate our meals. We had an ocean view and the breeze was fantastic. Note that some of the larger units have outdoor lanais with dining space. The one bedroom has a very large bathroom, which consists of a larger bathroom with a soaking tub, twin sink vanity, and a toilet, and a smaller bathroom with a shower, toilet, and single sink vanity. The two spaces are separated by a door. There were plenty of toiletries, there was dish soap and a sponge, and other useful things included. Note there wasn't any laundry detergent, but we bought a few laundry soap "pods" at the natural food store across the street, which sold the pods individually. The washer and dryer are stacked, front-loading, and very new.

reviews.text: We just returned today from the Waipouli Resort and are already researching prices for our reservations for next year. It was a wonderful vacation! The staff could not have been more pleasant and I was concerned as I had read things here at Trip Advisor that others had problems, We did not. Loved the Tahitian Bar-location, food, prices and the incredible staff. (Thanks Mike, Ben, Shelby, Rose, Carrie,Susie, Kimmie, et al.) We stayed in H-405 and it was beautiful. We had a water view from the lanai in our bedroom and enjoyed breakfast there every morning. Mike, the owner was very easy to work with and made everything go smoothly. Kapa'a is not Poipu but that is one of the things that I loved about the location. Having spent some of my youth growing up on Oahu, I felt the flavor of old Hawai'i here. There are lots of amenities nearby that make the location convenient. We did lots of driving to different areas and sometimes there was heavy traffic but we just said we are on vacation and in no rush. Thanks to everyone for making our stay so memorable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value, beautiful views as long as you have unit facing the water. Beach is treacherous but it's convenient enough to drive or walk up or down the highway from Waipouli to the beaches nearby, or farther (but still an easy drive) to the sunny south shore or the magical (but rainy) north shore. Beautiful units are well kept and very high quality build - I think it was built originally as residential rather than hotel, so the quality of all the fittings, sound-proofing of the walls etc. is better than a normal hotel. The units are well equipped with kitchens, and there is a Safeway across the street or Costco 10 minutes drive away, so it's perfect for a long family stay and eating in with friends and family. The town of Kapaa is an easy walk and quite charming. Highlight is the fantastic ukulele player who plays at the bar on Thurs evenings; don't bother with the bar, instead you can sit outside nearby and soak in the music while watching the waves, feeling the evening breeze with the moon rising over the water. Magical stuff.
reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SUPRISED
Excellent Choice For Families
reviews.text: I picked this hotel for our trip based upon Trip Advisor comments. I must say we were not disappointed. Everything was just as described by other reviewers. This is an almost brand-new facility and all of the furniture and accessories in the rooms are in top shape. The grounds are immaculate. The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. We were traveling with our 1-year-old and this was a perfect lodging choice for a family with toddlers. There appeared to be a lot of other families with young children as well, so this might not be the best destination for young singles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was AWESOME! It was perfect for our little one. The pool side restaurant was surprisingly good and the prices were not astronomical. There are many good restaurants within walking distance and there is a Safeway and a Foodland across the street. (We found Foodland to be more economical. Get yourself a free club card and save even more.) There is a Wal-Mart about 8 miles down the road in Lihue. I recommend going there or Costco (in Lihue also) at the beginning of your trip and fill up the fridge.

reviews.text: We liked Kapaa because it was centrally located. You are about 40 minutes from Poipu Beach and about 40 minutes from Princeville. Traffic can be a nightmare in Kauai, so choose your travel times accordingly. During commute hours, stay off the road!

reviews.text: The only drawback we found at the hotel was the cleaning service. Although everything was immaculate upon our arrival, we found the daily housekeeping service lacked a thorough cleaning. They told us that day 1-3 was a “light cleaning” and the 4th day they do a “full cleaning” to include mopping the floors, etc. We never saw this happen. We had to call housekeeping numerous times. They were extremely nice and always responded quickly—they just didn’t do a very good job.

Great place (if you can give up a couple of things!)
reviews.text: We recently returned from a week’s trip to Kauai, where we stayed at the Outrigger Waipouli Beach Resort. This is still a relatively new resort, but most of the construction is done. The beach-side bar was open on and off during our stay. It wasn’t great (at least from a cost or variety perspective) but it was definitely very scenic! The Aveda Spa was still not open, though they had set up some poolside cabanas (with privacy screens) where you can get a massage and/or other spa treatments. The gardens and landscaping has also developed well to the point where it looks very tropical and classy. The hotel grounds were kept very clean and litter-free.

reviews.title: What was that!?
reviews.text: The property itself is divided into 8 buildings (A thru H). We booked our trip through Costco vacations and requested an ocean-front 1 bedroom. However when we checked in, we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom oceanfront (H-101). This was easily the best room on the whole resort (well, at least in my opinion!). It was on the ground floor and all the patio doors opened into a beautiful lawn that bordered the beach. We could get our feet wet with the warm ocean waters in less than 15 seconds walk from the living room! During our stay there, we ran into the developer who built up the property. He mentioned that the particular unit we were staying in was sold for $3M! Nice!

reviews.title: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!!
reviews.text: As people have mentioned many times, the accommodations are top-class. Beautiful rooms, clean bathrooms, awesome kitchens and excellent amenities – exactly as many prior reviews have alluded to. All units have in-room washer and dryer and central air-conditioning. Super convenient when you come back from the beach and/or pool!

reviews.title: Sweeeeeeet Waipouli
reviews.text: Some things to note regarding the property, try to avoid units that face the main street (Kuhio Hwy) – as it faces the parking lot for the Safeway shopping center. Not a very Hawaiian view! The downside of being close to one of the bigger shopping areas on the Island is that you will take about 5-10 minutes for the light to change to make a left out of the property! Kuhio Hwy going south (towards Lihue) was crowded during the morning rush hour (yes, there is a rush hour on the island!). The advantage of being so close to Safeway meant that I walked over to get eggs when we ran out of them one early morning.

reviews.title: Love this place!
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel is very friendly and will try to help you get the best experience on Kauai. The check-in process was painless. They gave us a very generous welcome package – a beach bag, two baseball hats, sunscreen etc. If you have little kids, take them to the lobby at around 8:30 or 9:00 in the morning. That’s when they feed the Koi fish! It’s a lot of fun. My kids enjoyed tossing the fish food into the pond and watching the fish swim up to it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from a 5-night stay at the Outrigger Waipouli. Kapaa was a good location from which to base sightseeing -- about an even drive either north or south. Good restaurants nearby in Kapaa and having Safeway, ABC across the street was very convenient. The 2 BR condo we stayed in was brand new, top of the line. Kitchen had granite countertops, stainless appliances, everything needed to cook meals. Bedrooms had flat-screen TVs, nice furniture, bathrooms were spacious (we had 2-1/2 baths) and included tub in one. One of our showers had too strong water pressure, which was unpleasant, but the other was fine. Was great to use the in-unit full-size Whirlpool Duet washer/dryer while there to keep up on dirty laundry.
reviews.title: Great property, beautiful, new condo

reviews.text: Grounds included nice walking area by beach, nice pool, koi pond, free parking, free wifi. We only used the hot tub (sand bottom) once at night and some other people said they found a small crab in the hot tub. The pool's "lazy river" won't propel you around, but it is pretty. The grotto is neat too. The waterslides were closed during our whole stay - don't know why. Hotel seemed to be mostly vacant while we were there. It seemed the pool area would be nowhere big enough if more rooms were occupied, but then again, we were busy sightseeing all day, every day and never used the pool during the day.
